name: pipedrive
description: Pipedrive is a sales management tool built around pipeline visualization, lead tracking, activity reminders, and automation to keep deals progressing

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_CALL_LOG
tools.description: Adds a new call log.

note.title: Note
note.description: The note for the call log in HTML format

org_id.title: Org Id
org_id.description: The ID of the organization this call is associated with

deal_id.title: Deal Id
deal_id.description: The ID of the deal this call is associated with. A call log can be associated with either a deal or a lead, but not both at once.

lead_id.title: Lead Id
lead_id.description: The ID of the lead in the UUID format this call is associated with. A call log can be associated with either a deal or a lead, but not both at once.

outcome.title: Outcome
outcome.description: Describes the outcome of the call

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The name of the activity this call is attached to

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the owner of the call log. Please note that a user without account settings access cannot create call logs for other users.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: The date and time of the end of the call in UTC. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

person_id.title: Person Id
person_id.description: The ID of the person this call is associated with

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time of the start of the call in UTC. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

activity_id.title: Activity Id
activity_id.description: If specified, this activity will be converted into a call log, with the information provided. When this field is used, you don"t need to specify `deal_id`, `person_id` or `org_id`, as they will be ignored in favor of the values already available in the activity. The `activity_id` must refer to a `call` type activity.

from_phone_number.title: From Phone Number
from_phone_number.description: The number that made the call

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_CHANNEL
tools.description: New messaging channel added; registration limited to admins. Utilizes getConversations endpoint for data retrieval. Requires Messengers integration OAuth scope and a prepared Messaging app extension manifest.

avatar_url.title: Avatar Url
avatar_url.description: The URL for an icon that represents your channel

provider_type.title: Provider Type
provider_type.description: It controls the icons (like the icon next to the conversation)

template_support.title: Template Support
template_support.description: If true, enables templates logic on UI. Requires getTemplates endpoint implemented. Find out more [here](https://pipedrive.readme.io/docs/implementing-messaging-app-extension).

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_COMMENT_TO_A_NOTE
tools.description: Adds a new comment to a note.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the comment in HTML format. Subject to sanitization on the back-end.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_DEAL
tools.description: Add a new deal to Pipedrive with any custom fields, which vary by account and are identified by long hash keys. Check dealFields for existing custom fields. For details, visit the tutorial on adding a deal.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the deal (open, won, lost). Defaults to open

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: ID of the user who will be marked as owner of this deal

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency for the deal value (3-letter ISO code)

person_id.title: Person Id
person_id.description: ID of the person this deal is linked to

visible_to.title: Visible To
visible_to.description: Visibility of the deal (owner, entire company etc)

expected_close_date.title: Expected Close Date
expected_close_date.description: Expected close date in format YYYY-MM-DD

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_FOLLOWER_TO_A_DEAL
tools.description: Adds a follower to a deal.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_FOLLOWER_TO_AN_ORGANIZATION
tools.description: Adds a follower to an organization.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_FOLLOWER_TO_A_PERSON
tools.description: Adds a follower to a person.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_FOLLOWER_TO_A_PRODUCT
tools.description: Adds a follower to a product.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_LEAD
tools.description: Pipedrive API lets you add leads linked to people or organizations and tags them with 'API' source. Custom fields from deals apply to leads and appear in responses if set. Details are in the tutorials for adding and updating leads.

owner_id.title: Owner Id
owner_id.description: The ID of the user which will be the owner of the created lead. If not provided, the user making the request will be used.

was_seen.title: Was Seen
was_seen.description: A flag indicating whether the lead was seen by someone in the Pipedrive UI

label_ids.title: Label Ids
label_ids.description: The IDs of the lead labels which will be associated with the lead

person_id.title: Person Id
person_id.description: The ID of a person which this lead will be linked to. If the person does not exist yet, it needs to be created first. This property is required unless `organization_id` is specified.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The ID of an organization which this lead will be linked to. If the organization does not exist yet, it needs to be created first. This property is required unless `person_id` is specified.

expected_close_date.title: Expected Close Date
expected_close_date.description: The date of when the deal which will be created from the lead is expected to be closed. In ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_LEAD_LABEL
tools.description: Creates a lead label.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the lead label

color.title: Color
color.description: The color of the label. Only a subset of colors can be used.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_AN_ACTIVITY
tools.description: New activity added. Response includes `more_activities_scheduled_in_context` to show if more are planned with the same entity. See tutorial on adding activities [here](https://pipedrive.readme.io/docs/adding-an-activity).

done.title: Done
done.description: Whether the activity is done (0 = not done, 1 = done)

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the activity (matches ActivityTypes.key_string)

deal_id.title: Deal Id
deal_id.description: ID of the linked deal (integer or numeric string)

lead_id.title: Lead Id
lead_id.description: ID of the linked lead (UUID string)

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: ID of the user who owns the activity

attendees.title: Attendees
attendees.description: Attendees of the activity (contacts or external emails)

busy_flag.title: Busy Flag
busy_flag.description: Whether the activity marks the assignee as busy

public_description.title: Public Description
public_description.description: Public description synced to external calendar

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_DEAL_FIELD
tools.description: Adds a new deal field. For more information, see the tutorial for adding a new custom field.

options.title: Options
options.description: When `field_type` is either `set` or `enum`, possible options must be supplied [{"label":"red"}, {"label":"blue"}, {"label":"lilac"}]

field_type.title: Field Type
field_type.description: The type of the field. Supported values: varchar, varchar_auto, text, double, monetary, date, set, enum, user, org, people, phone, time, timerange, daterange, address

add_visible_flag.title: Add Visible Flag
add_visible_flag.description: Whether the field is available in "add new" modal or not (both in web and mobile app)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_FILTER
tools.description: New filter creation returns an ID. Only one primary condition group with 'AND' and two secondary groups (one 'AND', one 'OR') are supported. Future syntax expansion possible. See tutorial for details.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the filter. One of: deals, leads, org, people, products, activity, projects

conditions.title: Conditions
conditions.description: Filter conditions object. Must follow structure with a top-level 'and' group containing two groups (one 'and' and one 'or').

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_GOAL
tools.description: Adds a new goal. Along with adding a new goal, a report is created to track the progress of your goal.

type.title: Type

name.title: Name
name.description: Goal type name: deals_won, deals_progressed, activities_completed, activities_added, deals_started, revenue_forecast

pipeline_id.title: Pipeline Id
pipeline_id.description: Array of pipeline IDs or null for all pipelines

activity_type_id.title: Activity Type Id
activity_type_id.description: Array of activity type IDs or null (only for activities_* goals)

type.description: The type of the goal and its parameters

type.title: Type
type.description: Assignee type: person, company, or team

end.title: End
end.description: End date (YYYY-MM-DD) or null for open-ended

currency_id.title: Currency Id
currency_id.description: Currency ID (required when tracking_metric is sum)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_ORGANIZATION_FIELD
tools.description: Adds a new organization field. For more information, see the tutorial for adding a new custom field.

options.title: Options
options.description: When `field_type` is either `set` or `enum`, possible options must be supplied as a JSON-encoded sequential array, for example:</br>`[{"label":"red"}, {"label":"blue"}, {"label":"lilac"}]`

field_type.title: Field Type
field_type.description:
The type of the field
ValueDescription
`varchar`Text (up to 255 characters)
`varchar_auto`Autocomplete text (up to 255 characters)
`text`Long text (up to 65k characters)
`double`Numeric value
`monetary`Monetary field (has a numeric value and a currency value)
`date`Date (format YYYY-MM-DD)
`set`Options field with a possibility of having multiple chosen options
`enum`Options field with a single possible chosen option
`user`User field (contains a user ID of another Pipedrive user)
`org`Organization field (contains an organization ID which is stored on the same account)
`people`Person field (contains a product ID which is stored on the same account)
`phone`Phone field (up to 255 numbers and/or characters)
`time`Time field (format HH:MM:SS)
`timerange`Time-range field (has a start time and end time value, both HH:MM:SS)
`daterange`Date-range field (has a start date and end date value, both YYYY-MM-DD)
`address`Address field (autocompleted by Google Maps)

add_visible_flag.title: Add Visible Flag
add_visible_flag.description: Whether the field is available in "add new" modal or not (both in web and mobile app)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_PERSON_FIELD
tools.description: Adds a new person field. For more information, see the tutorial for adding a new custom field.

options.title: Options
options.description: When field_type is either set or enum, possible options must be supplied as a JSON-encoded sequential array, for example: [{"label":"red"}, {"label":"blue"}]

api_token.title: Api Token
api_token.description: Optional API token to use as query parameter when OAuth scope does not permit POST; if provided, overrides Authorization header.

field_type.title: Field Type
field_type.description: The type of the field. Allowed: address, date, daterange, double, enum, monetary, org, people, phone, set, text, time, timerange, user, varchar, varchar_auto, visible_to.

add_visible_flag.title: Add Visible Flag
add_visible_flag.description: Whether the field is available in the add new modal (web and mobile). Default true.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_PIPELINE
tools.description: Adds a new pipeline (v2).

is_deal_probability_enabled.title: Is Deal Probability Enabled
is_deal_probability_enabled.description: Whether deal probability is enabled for this pipeline

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_PRODUCT_FIELD
tools.description: Adds a new product field. For more information, see the tutorial for adding a new custom field.

options.title: Options
options.description: When `field_type` is either `set` or `enum`, possible options must be supplied as a JSON-encoded sequential array, for example:</br>`[{"label":"red"}, {"label":"blue"}, {"label":"lilac"}]`

field_type.title: Field Type
field_type.description:
The type of the field
ValueDescription
`varchar`Text (up to 255 characters)
`varchar_auto`Autocomplete text (up to 255 characters)
`text`Long text (up to 65k characters)
`double`Numeric value
`monetary`Monetary field (has a numeric value and a currency value)
`date`Date (format YYYY-MM-DD)
`set`Options field with a possibility of having multiple chosen options
`enum`Options field with a single possible chosen option
`user`User field (contains a user ID of another Pipedrive user)
`org`Organization field (contains an organization ID which is stored on the same account)
`people`Person field (contains a product ID which is stored on the same account)
`phone`Phone field (up to 255 numbers and/or characters)
`time`Time field (format HH:MM:SS)
`timerange`Time-range field (has a start time and end time value, both HH:MM:SS)
`daterange`Date-range field (has a start date and end date value, both YYYY-MM-DD)
`address`Address field (autocompleted by Google Maps)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_STAGE
tools.description: Adds a new stage, returns the ID upon success.

pipeline_id.title: Pipeline Id
pipeline_id.description: The ID of the pipeline to add stage to

rotten_days.title: Rotten Days
rotten_days.description: The number of days the deals not updated in this stage would become rotten. Applies only if the `rotten_flag` is set. (v2: days_to_rotten)

rotten_flag.title: Rotten Flag
rotten_flag.description: Whether deals in this stage can become rotten (v1: rotten_flag; v2: is_deal_rot_enabled)

deal_probability.title: Deal Probability
deal_probability.description: The success probability percentage of the deal. Used/shown when deal weighted values are used.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_TEAM
tools.description: Adds a new team to the company and returns the created object.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NEW_USER
tools.description: Adds a new user to the company, returns the ID upon success.

access.title: Access
access.description: The access given to the user. Each item in the array represents access to a specific app. Optionally may include either admin flag or permission set ID to specify which access to give within the app. If both are omitted, the default access for the corresponding app will be used. It requires structure as follows: `[{ app: "sales", permission_set_id: "62cc4d7f-4038-4352-abf3-a8c1c822b631" }, { app: "global", admin: true }, { app: "account_settings" }]`

active_flag.title: Active Flag
active_flag.description: Whether the user is active or not. `false` = Not activated, `true` = Activated

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_AN_INSTALLMENT_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Adds a new installment subscription. Note: Subscriptions endpoints may not be available on the company-specific base URL. To avoid 404s, this action overrides the default request behavior and uses the public API host (api.pipedrive.com) explicitly.

deal_id.title: Deal Id
deal_id.description: The ID of the deal this installment subscription is associated with

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the installment subscription. Accepts a 3-character currency code.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: Array of payments. It requires a minimum structure as follows: [{ amount:SUM, description:DESCRIPTION, due_at:PAYMENT_DATE }]. Replace SUM with a payment amount, DESCRIPTION with an explanation string, PAYMENT_DATE with a date (format YYYY-MM-DD).

update_deal_value.title: Update Deal Value
update_deal_value.description: Indicates that the deal value must be set to the installment subscription"s total value

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_AN_ORGANIZATION
tools.description: Set up a new Pipedrive organization using custom fields with unique key hashes. Retrieve `organizationFields` for configuration. Check the linked tutorial for guidance.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_NOTE
tools.description: Add a note to a deal, person, organization, lead, or project in Pipedrive. At least one of deal_id, person_id, org_id, lead_id, or project_id must be provided.

org_id.title: Org Id
org_id.description: The ID of the organization this note will be attached to. Required unless one of (deal_id/person_id/lead_id/project_id) is specified.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the note in HTML format. Subject to sanitization on the back-end.

deal_id.title: Deal Id
deal_id.description: The ID of the deal the note will be attached to. Required unless one of (lead_id/person_id/org_id/project_id) is specified.

lead_id.title: Lead Id
lead_id.description: The ID of the lead the note will be attached to (UUID format). Required unless one of (deal_id/person_id/org_id/project_id) is specified.

add_time.title: Add Time
add_time.description: The optional creation date & time of the note in UTC. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

person_id.title: Person Id
person_id.description: The ID of the person this note will be attached to. Required unless one of (deal_id/lead_id/org_id/project_id) is specified.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The ID of the project the note will be attached to. Required unless one of (deal_id/person_id/org_id/lead_id) is specified.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_PARTICIPANT_TO_A_DEAL
tools.description: Adds a participant to a deal.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_PERSON
tools.description: Add a new contact in Pipedrive with optional custom fields unique to each account found using the `personFields` endpoint. The endpoint also handles `data.marketing_status` for Campaigns product users.

items.title: ContactItem

label.title: Label
label.description: Label for the item (e.g., work, home)

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Whether this is the primary item

items.description: Email/Phone item schema used by Pipedrive v1 for persons.

email.title: Email
email.description: List of email objects: { value: string, label?: string, primary?: bool }

items.title: ContactItem

label.title: Label
label.description: Label for the item (e.g., work, home)

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Whether this is the primary item

items.description: Email/Phone item schema used by Pipedrive v1 for persons.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: List of phone objects: { value: string, label?: string, primary?: bool }

owner_id.title: Owner Id
owner_id.description: ID of the user who will be marked as the owner of this person

label_ids.title: Label Ids
label_ids.description: IDs of labels to assign to the person

visible_to.title: Visible To
visible_to.description: Visibility of the person (e.g., 1=owner only, 3=entire company)

marketing_status.title: Marketing Status
marketing_status.description: Marketing status (no_consent, unsubscribed, subscribed, archived). Field is available only when Campaigns is enabled.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_PRODUCT
tools.description: Adds a new product to the Products inventory. For more information, see the tutorial for adding a product.

items.title: ProductPrice

price.title: Price
price.description: Price amount in the given currency

items.description: Price object for product prices array

owner_id.title: Owner Id
owner_id.description: Owner user ID; if omitted, authorized user ID is used

is_linkable.title: Is Linkable
is_linkable.description: Whether the product can be added to a deal

billing_frequency.title: Billing Frequency
billing_frequency.description: Billing frequency (one-time, annually, semi-annually, quarterly, monthly, weekly)

billing_frequency_cycles.title: Billing Frequency Cycles
billing_frequency_cycles.description: Number of billing repeats (rules depend on billing_frequency)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_PRODUCT_TO_A_DEAL
tools.description: Adds a product to a deal, creating a new item called a deal-product.

product_id.title: Product Id
product_id.description: The ID of the product to attach

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_PROJECT
tools.description: Adds a new project. Note that you can supply additional custom fields along with the request that are not described here. These custom fields are different for each Pipedrive account and can be recognized by long hashes as keys.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: IDs of labels for this project

board_id.title: Board Id
board_id.description: The ID of a project board

deal_ids.title: Deal Ids
deal_ids.description: IDs of deals associated with this project

phase_id.title: Phase Id
phase_id.description: The ID of a phase on the project board

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: ID of the template the project will be based on

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_RECURRING_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Adds a new recurring subscription.

deal_id.title: Deal Id
deal_id.description: The ID of the deal this recurring subscription is associated with

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the recurring subscription. Accepts a 3-character currency code.

infinite.title: Infinite
infinite.description: This indicates that the recurring subscription will last until it"s manually canceled or deleted. Note that only one field must be set: `cycles_count` or `infinite`.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: Array of additional payments. It requires a minimum structure as follows: [{ amount:SUM, description:DESCRIPTION, due_at:PAYMENT_DATE }]. Replace SUM with a payment amount, DESCRIPTION with an explanation string, PAYMENT_DATE with a date (format YYYY-MM-DD).

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of the recurring subscription. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the recurring subscription

cycles_count.title: Cycles Count
cycles_count.description: Shows how many payments the subscription has. Note that one field must be set: `cycles_count` or `infinite`. If `cycles_count` is set, then `cycle_amount` and `start_date` are also required.

update_deal_value.title: Update Deal Value
update_deal_value.description: Indicates that the deal value must be set to recurring subscription"s MRR value

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_ROLE
tools.description: Adds a new role. Note: - Roles endpoints require the `admin` scope. - For OAuth tokens, Pipedrive expects the company domain base URL with `/api/v1` path. Example: https://{COMPANY}.pipedrive.com/api/v1/roles - This action normalizes the base_url provided by metadata to ensure `/api/v1` is used.

parent_role_id.title: Parent Role Id
parent_role_id.description: The ID of the parent role

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_A_TASK
tools.description: Adds a new task.

parent_task_id.title: Parent Task Id
parent_task_id.description: The ID of a parent task; cannot be a subtask’s ID

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_FILE
tools.description: Upload and link files to deals, people, organizations, activities, products, or leads in Pipedrive. See the "adding a file" tutorial for details.

name.title: Name
name.description: File name, contains extension to indetify the file type

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_NEW_ACTIVITY_TYPE
tools.description: Adds a new activity type.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the activity type

color.title: Color
color.description: A designated color for the activity type in 6-character HEX format (e.g. `FFFFFF` for white, `000000` for black)

icon_key.title: Icon Key
icon_key.description: Icon graphic to use for representing this activity type

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_OR_UPDATE_ROLE_SETTING
tools.description: Adds or updates the visibility setting for a role. Notes: - Roles endpoints require the `admin` OAuth scope. - OAuth calls must target the company domain with `/api/v1` path, e.g., https://{COMPANY}.pipedrive.com/api/v1/roles/{id}/settings - This action normalizes the base URL accordingly.

value.title: Value
value.description:
Possible values for the `default_visibility` setting depending on the subscription plan:
Essential / Advanced plan
ValueDescription
`1`Owner & Followers
`3`Entire company

Professional / Enterprise plan
ValueDescription
`1`Owner only
`3`Owner's visibility group
`5`Owner's visibility group and sub-groups
`7`Entire company

Read more about visibility groups here.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_PERSON_PICTURE
tools.description: This service allows adding a photo to a person's profile, replacing any existing one. Images must be square with a minimum size of 128 pixels and in GIF, JPG, or PNG formats. They will be resized to 128 and 512 pixels.

file.title: FileType

name.title: Name
name.description: File name, contains extension to indetify the file type

file.description: Image file to set as the person's picture (GIF/JPG/PNG)

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_ROLE_ASSIGNMENT
tools.description: Assigns a user to a role. Notes: - Roles endpoints require the `admin` OAuth scope. - OAuth calls must target the company domain with `/api/v1` path, e.g., https://{COMPANY}.pipedrive.com/api/v1/roles/{id}/assignments - This action normalizes the base URL accordingly and ensures JSON body is sent.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ADD_USERS_TO_A_TEAM
tools.description: Adds users to an existing team.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ARCHIVE_A_PROJECT
tools.description: Archives a project.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_ATTACH_AN_AUDIO_FILE_TO_THE_CALL_LOG
tools.description: Adds an audio recording to the call log. That audio can be played by those who have access to the call log object.

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID received when you create the call log

name.title: Name
name.description: File name, contains extension to indetify the file type

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_CANCEL_A_RECURRING_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Cancels a recurring subscription. This action attempts to cancel a recurring subscription via Subscriptions API. If Subscriptions endpoints are unavailable (404), it gracefully falls back to disabling all product attachments on the given deal (interpreting `id` as `deal_id`) to mimic cancellation behavior.

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the subscription. Fallback: treated as the deal ID when Subscriptions API is unavailable.

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The subscription termination date. All payments after the specified date will be deleted. The end_date of the subscription will be set to the due date of the payment to follow the specified date. Default value is the current date.

tools.name: PIPEDRIVE_CREATE_A_NEW_WEBHOOK
tools.description: Creates and returns details of a new Webhook. Trigger events combine `event_action` and `event_object`, like `*.*` for all events or `added.deal`, `deleted.persons` for specific actions. More info in the Webhooks guide.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user that this webhook will be authorized with. You have the option to use a different user"s `user_id`. If it is not set, the current user"s `user_id` will be used. As each webhook event is checked against a user"s permissions, the webhook will only be sent if the user has access to the specified object(s). If you want to receive notifications for all events, please use a top-level admin user’s `user_id`.

event_action.title: Event Action
event_action.description: The type of action to receive notifications about. Wildcard will match all supported actions.

event_object.title: Event Object
event_object.description: The type of object to receive notifications about. Wildcard will match all supported objects.

http_auth_user.title: Http Auth User
http_auth_user.description: The HTTP basic auth username of the subscription URL endpoint (if required)

subscription_url.title: Subscription Url
subscription_url.description: A full, valid, publicly accessible URL which determines where to send the notifications. Please note that you cannot use Pipedrive API endpoints as the `subscription_url` and the chosen URL must not redirect to another link.

http_auth_password.title: Http Auth Password

tools.description: Query goal data by appending `{searchField}={searchValue}` to the URL with dot-notation fields and values. Include `is_active` to filter by goal status and specify both `period.start` and `period.end` for time-based searches.

is_active.title: Is Active
is_active.description: Whether the goal is active or not

type__name.title: TypeNameEnm
type__name.description: The type of the goal. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

period__end.description: The end date of the period for which to find goals. Date in format of YYYY-MM-DD.

assignee__id.title: Assignee  Id
assignee__id.description: The ID of the user who"s goal to fetch. When omitted, only your goals will be returned.

period__start.title: Period  Start
period__start.description: The start date of the period for which to find goals. Date in format of YYYY-MM-DD. When `period.start` is provided, `period.end` must be provided too.

assignee__type.title: AssigneeTypeEnm
assignee__type.description: The type of the goal"s assignee. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

type__params__stage__id.description: The ID of the stage. Applicable to only `deals_progressed` type of goals. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

expected__outcome__target.title: Expected  Outcome  Target
expected__outcome__target.description: The numeric value of the outcome. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

type__params__pipeline__id.title: Type  Params  Pipeline  Id
type__params__pipeline__id.description: An array of pipeline IDs or `null` for all pipelines. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

expected__outcome__currency__id.title: Expected  Outcome  Currency  Id
expected__outcome__currency__id.description: The numeric ID of the goal"s currency. Only applicable to goals with `expected_outcome.tracking_metric` with value `sum`. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

type__params__activity__type__id.title: Type  Params  Activity  Type  Id
type__params__activity__type__id.description: An array of IDs or `null` for all activity types. Only applicable for `activities_completed` and/or `activities_added` types of goals. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

expected__outcome__tracking__metric.title: ExpectedOutcomeTrackingMetricEnm
expected__outcome__tracking__metric.description: The tracking metric of the expected outcome of the goal. If provided, everyone"s goals will be returned.

until.title: Until

The type of the interval
ValueDescription
`day`Day
`week`A full week (7 days) starting from `start_date`
`month`A full month (depending on the number of days in given month) starting from `start_date`
`quarter`A full quarter (3 months) starting from `start_date`
